entry.title: Five use cases where a npm private proxy fits in your workflow
entry.summary:
This article is about why setting up a npm private proxy is a good idea, going through most common questions that I’ve been asked since contributing to sinopia’s fork [verdaccio](http://www.verdaccio.org/), and how a developer addresses many use cases that made me appreciate how useful it can be set up a local private proxy Let’s review them.
## As offline installation
![An image from the slides doesn’t load due lack of connection](/img/blog/offline.png)
These days the solution to offline mode is called yarn and lately npm@5.x . It’s a valid argument, both clients are awesome. The offline mode works fine but does not solve all the offline issues.
